description: Retention of single storey side extensions and rear conservatory and amendment to planning permission dated 29/9/06, ref. 1982/APP/2006/1690: Erection of part single storey, part two storey rear extension, extension to left side roof incorporating installation of front dormer window and replacement of four with three rooflights to allow retention of extension as built with roof alterations including two rooflights replacing three rooflights to rear elevation of main roof, replacement of dummy pitched roof to single storey rear extension with flat roof, alterations to fenestration detail, provision of first floor rear doors with Juliette Balcony (Retrospective Application) and extension to left hand roof and erection of a 1.6m high front boundary wall with railings.
decision_conditions: The proposed front boundary wall by reason of its height and design, would fail to harmonise with existing front boundary walls in the street and as such would detract from the character and appearance of the street scene and the Hillingdon Court Park Area of Special Local Character, contrary to policies BE5, BE13 and BE19 of the adopted Hillingdon Unitary Development Plan (Saved Policies, September 2007) and section 10.0 of the Hillingdon Design & Accessibility Statement: 'Residential Extensions'.

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Unitary Development Plan Saved Policies (September 2007) set out below, and to all relevant material considerations, including Supplementary Planning Guidance:
eg. BE13       Layout and appearance of new development
